New addon in the works that is intended for the hunter class. As the title hints at, the addon is focusing on hunter pets, specifically things pertaining to the use of the stables, along with features involving the process of looking for, and taming new pets. If anyone’s interested, we would very much like it if you check it out, both for personal use and/or to provide feedback towards its ongoing development.
Link to the addon page: https://www.curseforge.com/wow/addons/istablemaster 143
Layout option 1:
Layout option 2:
Please visit the addon page for more info on the current state along with what’s planned for future updates.
Again, any feedback is much appreciated!
OMG!!! This looks amazing. And the taming guide too. The stable master interface is not very nice but this looks so much better.
I’m super excited about this. Can’t wait to see how it progresses.
Interesting… Do you still have to be at a Stable Master to fully interact with the addon?

You do yes. With this addon, you do have the option to open the stables from anywhere in the world, even when not at a stable master. Though, if you actually want to manage/switch your pets, you need to talk to a stable master still.
There’s no way around that in terms of an addon or similar.
It is, however, possible to access your stables without talking to a stable master in a city, by using this item(craftable by engineers):
Two hotfixes have been implemented for the addon.
(Also an alpha version - V0.33 available)
#https://www.curseforge.com/wow/addons/istablemaster/files 14

Both can be installed/downloaded via addon managers.
(If you want the alpha-release, make sure that you have the addon flagged for alpha-releases)

Sorry for the hiatus, due to some IRL stuff, development of the addon had to be put on hold. It is now back up, and there’s a new alpha build available for use/testing. If you’re using an addon-manager for installation, it may be required to flag the addon for alpha releases, in order to see new updates.

Youre reply is something id expect from a 6 year old with a bad attitude. I hope for youre sake thats true, otherwise you just made youreself look real dumb at noones expense for no reason at all.

many class abilities that got re-added in shadowlands are honestly just there for flavor. their damage and functionality is limited unless you’re the right spec. and that’s the case here–steady shot and arcane shot are there in the spellbook for all three specs, but they’re not good for all three specs. they’re not meant to be.

if you want to get in range sometimes to take potshots at other melees, you don’t need to equip a bow. survival can weave in and out of melee by applying dots and picking up range-oriented talents–aspect of the eagle, wildfire bomb build, basically all of the capstone talents in the class tree. you’ll still deal your best damage while in melee, but you can definitely deal damage at range without relying on stuff that’s not “for” survival.
Marksmanship has the lowest passive focus regen of all three specs. Steady shot is a part of the rotation for MM.

Hi so I’ve returned to my hunter after about 6 months of not playing him and my question is- What “Spells” should I keep on my bars as I’m running out of space already at level 42?
I’m playing a Beast Mastery Spec. Also what two types of pets should I have out?
Any help will be greatly appreciated.
Thank You

You should always have a choice of a ferocity pet (for bloodlust) and tenacity pet (pref spirit beast) for pve, depending on group needs. for pvp you will usually want a cunning pet with mortal strike (debuff to healing received by targets). petopia has a guide of various pet families and their abilities.

your second pet is entirely aesthetic - its family doesn’t matter, so you can use anything you want for your animal companion pet. most hunters try to match two of the same type eg if they’re using loque’nahak as their main pet they might try and tame a second loque’nahak as their a/c pet for the symmetry, but you don’t have to.
Core rotational abilities: Kill shot, cobra shot, barbed shot, kill command, multi-shot, bestial wrath
I’m going back and doing the Legion Class Hall questline. At what point does Pan the Kind Hand NPC offer goods to buy? Currently, he shows nothing, but I know he’s supposed to, including some mounts.

After you finish the Class Hall Campaign and the “Breaching the Tomb” achievement. (If you already did “Breaching the Tomb” on another character, you only need to go until you recruiter your Champion.) Then you’ll do the quest to get the mount, and Pan will sell the goods.
Much obliged!

I’ve been testing Survival hunter, and to be honest, Fury of the Eagle is not doing it. The ability was recently buffed, yet the damage output feels low. I think that having it in a 45-sec cooldown is terrible, plus the fact its cd can only be reset when getting procs of KC is not enough. In legion, the ability could be buffed based on Mongoose fury stacks, which made it hit super hard. I think the ability works well with the melee hunter idea but needs to be available more often or be been buffed so it is competitive with other cooldowns.

It should also cost focus, not a lot but some along with buffing its damage.
Either butchery or Carve should also buff its damage stacking maybe 3-5 times to encourage it being used as an endcap to the aoe rotation.
I think CA lacks the power of other major CDs, like wings or Combustion; if only it gave us some extra haste attack power, I would be happy.

Well its on the bomb side the tree i wish it proc more bombs and that bombs lower its CD and marauder was just remade to be a 1 point talent and that the new spearhead should proc more flanking strikes that give more focus the KC procs within in the time limit and at 70 we can go even more bombs or killshot depending if we went FoE side or Spearhead side.

Wowhead says it’s Agility, but Icy veins says it’s mastery. Both pages say they are for Dragonflight. Which stat does Blizzard say is the primary stat?
Agility is a primary stat. Mastery is a secondary stat.

Agility will always give you the biggest boost, but you can’t really adjust gear for more agility. Secondary stats are where you choose what you stack. Now that our pets do so much of our damage, Mastery has become a much stronger secondary stat, but you need to balance it with Haste, Crit and Vers as well.
Primary stats - Strength, Agility, Intellect
Secondary stats - Crit, Haste, Mastery, Versatility
(Tertiary stats - Speed, Leech, Avoidance, etc)

What do you think of allowing SV Hunters to equip a 2-hander melee weapon and a bow/gun/crossbow in the ranged slot? Make that a unique thing for the spec, rather than just bringing out a generic vanilla looking crossbow for abilities like Serpent Sting and the new Arcane Shot in SL, which actually requires a ranged weapon.

it’d be a better idea to just have a glyph like demo locks have rather than make survival farm 2 weapons to be effective. keep in mind, if you can equip a piece, it adds stats which means the ranged weapon becomes a stat stick and having a bad weapon will lower your dps.
Personally, I wish they’d go back to all hunters being able to equip melee and ranged weapons. Didn’t make sense to take that away in the 1st place.

I do think bringing back the additional weapon slots for some classes makes sense. Warriors and hunter are prime examples. I would also prefer that survival could 2h or duelweild. Personally I would have no issue with farming up 3 weapons.

Historically, Hunters have attacked from range unless a foe came within melee. At that point, you were mainly using Wing Clip to get back out to range. When ranged weapon minimum range was removed there was no longer any reason for melee weapons or attacks.

I miss having melee and ranged weapons as a hunter. I think it would be great if they would bring that back to hunters. Some people just say “oh but now I have to get more items to gear” but to me, it’s just another part of the journey.
for PvP, I hate being tied to concussive shot. I miss being ranged, and when someone gets close I can Wing clip them. Just another tool in the bag baby.
I mean hunters were farming multiple weapons for years before and had no issues. Now with additional loot rng like forging and corruption gone, it will be even easier to get BiS for both.
Thank you for the history lesson, it’s not like I haven’t played a hunter since Vanilla or anything.
Then why can’t you understand that Hunters don’t need melee weapons anymore?
Everything is hunter loot again!

So, your assertion is that a class that always had the ability to equip melee weapons and used melee weapons at melee and ranged at ranged, making them the most unique class in the game, that it made sense just to arbitrarily remove their melee abilities and ability to wield melee weapons?

Well, as it turns out, removing melee from hunters and making ranged weapons work in melee removed the justification for ranged to hit harder, because it removed a large weakness of the class. So you can say they don’t /need/ melee all you want, doesn’t mean that I would not have personally preferred them to not do that.
But hey, continue to be condescending.

Except mages, druids, and warlocks were always able to use their ranged abilities within melee range. Anyways, hunter melee abilities sucked: you used them when you had to, but there’s a reason wing clip was almost always cast at the same time as disengage.

Yeah, but they had a weakness originally in the push back. Used to be if you were being hit while trying to cast a spell it would take longer to cast said spell. They also wear lighter armor and were generally less survivable then hunters.

We used melee weapons because if we didn’t once a melee got within melee range of us the only thing hurting them would be the pet. Needless to say, that would give a distinct advantage to melee classes when facing a hunter. Once they removed the minimum range, there was no longer a need for melee abilities as we could now use our better attacks at melee range. Not to mention the fact that our melee abilities were really weak anyway.

And you don’t think it comes from the fact that BM hunter (and even the whole class in MoP) can use it’s whole rotation from 40 yards away while moving? Caster classes hit harder because they have to stand still (not to mention that they cause magic damage rather than physical).
Preference is one thing. If you liked having the ability to melee in addition to ranged based on where an enemy was at, fine. Saying you don’t understand why is another issue.
Then don’t come back at me with:

If i take Lone Wolf in the MM tree and then take both ranks of Hunter’s knowledge but don’t actually use Lone Wolf, does the Hunter’s knowledge talent still work or do i HAVE to be in Lone Wolf in order for Hunter’s knowledge to work?

Hunter’s knowledge will work with or without Lone Wolf.
Do note that your pet, without Lone Wolf, do about 7-8% of a MM hunter’s dps, so lone Wolf is more of a 3% dps increase. More during AOE.
Still a very good talent, unless you do only PVP or Solo world content, in that case, having a pet is superior. (Mortal strike for pvp and tanking for solo world content)

There’s a lot of complaint about survival losing flayed shot.
Here’s an idea: Re-work flanking strike a little to work similar to the way flayed shot made killshot work.
So, give flanking strike a chance to proc and have it apply a bleed.
Flanking strike is both weaker than kill shot, pet reliant, and short range. It sounds like a good compromise.

I think that’s overloading flanking strike as an ability a little bit. I like where it’s at as a big hitting generator, if anything I’d want it to scale with mongoose fury stacks so after you dump your focus with MB you flanking strike and it hits like a truck AND rebuilds your focus. On top of that I’ve seen many people suggest a talent that makes RS/MB reduce the cooldown of flanking by 1 second. I think with both of these potential talents it makes flanking a more interesting ability that’s not just “better Kill Command every 30 seconds”.
They should really just bring back flayed in the class tree somewhere. I’d hate to also take it away from the other specs if it was just on the SV tree.
“Overloading” flanking strike? Are you saying that flayed shot is “overloading” Killshot?
My suggestion is essentially a very nerfed version of what flayed shot does and it integrates directly into the existing tree, means it would be very simple to integrate.

Also, tying Mongoose Bite’s damage modifier to other things would be ridiculous. Mongoose bite is already a must have for competitive dps, and doing that would make mb even more prominent. I hate mongoose bite.

Instead of overloading what I meant is more overdoing it with a rework. Flanking as it is, is a good ability it’s just a little bare bones on its own right now. I don’t think it needs to be replaced by a completely separate ability (by ability I mean function) for no reason. There’s no reason flayed shot can’t be added somewhere in the tree or class tree while flanking stays the same. I don’t think that a completely different version of an ability is “very simple to integrate” vs just adding in what already exists somewhere in the tree.

For your MB point: I’m curious as to why you hate mongoose bite. Is it because you feel the ability is a little too spammy? I hear that a lot but in reality making it more important (with Mongoose Fury also working for FS for example) would solve the issue of it having this isolated importance (spam).

would love to see survival get a flayed shot talent. it could fit in place of the talent that gives a chance to shoot an arcane shot… we don’t use arcane shot under normal circumstances, so that talent just feels kind of tacked on

Do you both use Elvui? Scroll-out buttons not working is an issue with that addon (also affecting summon demon for warlocks, mage ports and rogue poisons). apparently the issue is blizz-side and there’s nothing ElvUI devs can do about it.
That’s an addon issue. Apparently something on Blizzard’s end broke flyouts in 10.0. All the UI mods (Elvui, Dominos, etc) have this problem right now.

By “stable” do you mean your actual stable, or do you mean the part where you can carry a certain amount of pets with you wherever you go?
In short, visit a Stable Master in any city and make sure you have a pet placed in the first Stable slot.
Pick the Animal Companion talent, and whenever you call out one of your pets, that second pet should appear shortly after.
Making sure I carry 5 pets and no slots are empty.
Ah, then go visit a Stable Master in any main city(wherever you can find one) and place one pet in the first slot in the stables.

Why do we have to make hard decisions between class/spec spells we had access to only yesterday… when some other classes can pick all those spells PLUS have enough points left over for EXTRA utility/healing spells from specs they arent even playing?

Why do some classes retain some utility spells without having to talent into them, and yet we have to waste a point on Concussion shot, a spell so iconic and NECESSARY it was one of the earliest spells new hunters earned? (level 4!)
Why is Explosive Trap effectively removed from the game? Making anyone choose between Intimidation and anything else is no choice at all.
Why do I have to waste a talent on Misdirection? Or waste my time respecing into it and out of it each time I step out into the world?
Who would EVER waste a precious point on Scare Beast?
Why is the likes of Tar Trap even a talent in itself? and not simply improved via the tree?
Why do we have to pretend serpent sting and steel trap are suddenly high tier abilities now?

Meanwhile mongo melee retain, and even gain mobility, healing, cc, and even get ridiculous covenant utility spells thrown in to boot? We get a povo, significantly nerfed Sentinel Owl, that is a situational arena ability, versus the likes of The Hunt, Spear of Bastion, Grabby Hands…
What in the hell is going on?
Feedback and suggestions were left behind
The Scare Beast talent legit made me laugh.

What had me laughing were the spec trees. Harpoon nerfed, going from a 20s cd to a 30s cd… unless I invest a second talent point to take an additional talent that takes it back down to 20s… but also makes it instantly break any soft CC on the target by adding a cheeky little dot.

[Terms of Engagement]
Talent
Requires Hunter (Survival)
Requires level 15
Harpoon has a 10 sec reduced cooldown, and deals (50% of Attack power) Physical damage and generates 20 Focus over 10 sec. Killing an enemy resets the cooldown of Harpoon.

The ultimate root cause is that you have a class that’s defined around ranged weapons necessitating common foundational elements like Kill Shot but you have a spec that arbitrarily avoids that core element of the class. So they need to either make weird “some ranged abilities” compromises like this to keep the spec as recognisably a Hunter while still getting their melee fix, OR they can just ignore the class entirely and run off and make something that’s effectively its own class. The latter is what they did in Legion and it was an infamous disaster (at least a more intense disaster than everything that came after).
It would be better thematically if Kill Shot was a base ability and Survival had a core ability like “Finish Them Off (Replaces Kill Shot) (Requires 2H Weapon)”
